statement: Let \(ABCD\) be a parallelogram with \(AB = a\), \(AD = 1\) and \(\angle BAD = \alpha\). If triangle \(ABD\) is acute, prove that the four unit circles centered at \(A, B, C, D\) cover the parallelogram if and only if \(a \leq \cos \alpha + \sqrt{3} \sin \alpha\).
Prove that if exactly one edge of a tetrahedron is greater than 1, then its volume is \(\leq 1/8\).

Let \(k, m, n\) be natural numbers with \(m + k + 1\) prime and \(> n + 1\). Put \(c_s = s(s + 1)\). Prove that the product \((c_{m+1} - c_k)(c_{m+2} - c_k)\cdots(c_{m+n} - c_k)\) is divisible by \(c_1 c_2 \cdots c_n\).

Given two acute-angled triangles \(A_0B_0C_0\) and \(A_1B_1C_1\), determine (and construct) the triangle \(ABC\) similar to \(A_1B_1C_1\), circumscribed about \(A_0B_0C_0\) (\(A_0\) on \(BC\), \(B_0\) on \(CA\), \(C_0\) on \(AB\)), that has maximum area.
Let \(c_n = a_1^n + a_2^n + \cdots + a_8^n\) with real numbers \(a_i\) not all zero. If infinitely many \(c_n\) vanish, find all natural numbers \(n\) for which \(c_n = 0\).

A sports contest awarded \(m\) medals over \(n > 1\) days. Day 1: 1 medal plus 1/7 of the remainder; day 2: 2 medals plus 1/7 of the new remainder; â€¦; day \(n\): the last \(n\) medals. Find \(n\) and \(m\).
